website_summaries.verdict: Simple and satisfying, Panasonic's Lumix DMC-FH27 is an excellent point-and-shoot value.
pros: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH27 is a straightforward point-and-shoot with a flexible lens and useful touch-screen operation
cons: Its 16-megapixel resolution is a bit of a waste and you can't use the optical zoom while recording movies

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this camera. Easy to use, the controls are intuitive, and the pictures are great. I returned the first camera I got of this model because of a defect with the lens - no problem about doing that and the replacement came quickly and works great. It's a good size to fit in my purse and the zoom is plenty for pretty much any situation. I would buy this camera again.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia McGill

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, sharp pictures
customer_reviews.text: I am something of a photo bug and I researched this camera thoroughly before buying it for my daughter in law. The camera has fulfilled all my expectations plus. I set up the camera and from then on the pictures were beautiful. She loves the camera and I get pictures of my grandchildren. A real win-win situation. We found no problem with the touch-screen sensitivity nor was it particularly difficult to figure out how to set up the camera as we wished.
customer_reviews.author: Don J. Brand

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH27
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this camera 2 years ago and have been extremely happy with it. It is easy to use and the picture results are fantastic. With this camera, you get more then its value. Mine was stolen and I am now replacing it with the same camera manufacturer and model. Highly recommend this particular camera.
customer_reviews.author: Prime & Kindle  Customerclairecl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for the amount I paid
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera for the amount I paid. Not the very best available, but very good for point and shoot pics taken on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: M. R.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, like new
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for my old one and it is just as good - like new and the price was great.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: This is a good camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a good camera for the money. We had one for a couple of years, but dropped it in the ocean, by accident. This is the same model.
customer_reviews.author: D.Smith

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THE COMPACT SIZE
customer_reviews.text: HAVE HAD TWO OTHER LUMIX BRANDS. WELL MADE AND LAST ITS MONEYS WORTH. TALKED MY CHILDREN INTO PURCHASING THE LUMIX BRAND.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth m woodruff

customer_reviews.title: Leicha lens makes this camera exceptional
customer_reviews.text: Still use it a lot. The pictures are incredible. The key to the success of this camera is its Liecha lens which does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey O.

customer_reviews.title: Great Point and Click
customer_reviews.text: Great basic point and click camera. Takes nice movies. The touchscreen is a little coarse, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Grotenhuis

customer_reviews.title: Great images here
customer_reviews.text: I love, it fun to use great pixel give a very shape image. The 3" screen give it a better way of view the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good camera. Actually, better than we thought it would be. I would recommend this to anyone looking to buy a very affordable camera that's loaded with options and yet easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: blackdog girl

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera. My only negative is there is no zoom function when shooting a video like my older model Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: Retired In Baja

customer_reviews.title: Lumix DMC-FH27
customer_reviews.text: Hello!!! Has received camera Lumix DMC-FH27 delivery to Russia 17.01.2012. With quality it is happy! The camera good, in êîìëåêòå a charger, the accumulator, a cord for connection to the computer, a cord for TV, a disk with on, a bag, card 2ÃÁ. BUT in the Description it has been told 4ÃÁ!!!. In general with purchase Vladimir is happy yours faithfully
customer_reviews.author: Âëàäèìèð

customer_reviews.title: fine camera
customer_reviews.text: it's a good camera . has a lot of nice features and easy to operate would recommend to buy this camera
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hoheneder

customer_reviews.title: Lumix digital camera
customer_reviews.text: We took our new camera on a trip to Maui and it worked very well. The only exception was on a sunset cruise, when the battery ran out and I missed many good photo opportunities. I'm still adjusting to the camera, but so far I'm liking it.
customer_reviews.author: Heybuck

customer_reviews.title: fx01  stilly favorate
customer_reviews.text: touch screen takes some getting use to. I really dont find the touch screen easy to use at all. more time consuming. have to search around for what your looking for. I'd stay away from this one if I were you. My FX-01 is still my favorate.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Miller

customer_reviews.title: pictures are washed out looking
customer_reviews.text: We may have just gotten a lemon, but ours worked in every way except that, flash or daylight, the pictures look washed out on the Automatic setting, and there's no way to default to "smaller F-stop" (to use the old photography lingo). It might do better with manual setting, but the whole idea for us was that it be easy to use, and having to manually adjust it all the time makes it pretty much useless on that score. Our iPhones take much better pictures, more easily, lacking only the zoom feature. :-(
customer_reviews.author: jdh

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pocket Size Compact
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little camera that I bought to capture high definition photos when I'm out and about and not carrying my Nikon DSLR. It doesn't do so well with real close up macros but it takes great photos overall and they are clear and fairly crisp. The files size is large (over 6 MB for the high setting). The battery life is definitely a problem and spare batteries are available but still expensive at the time of this review ($35-$50 range). It eats up battery power even when the camera is turned off. In bright sunlight the LCD screen is difficult to see. Operationally the camera is easy to use and turns out good photos.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Lathrop

customer_reviews.title: The touch screen is not a good thing from my point of view
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a gift, new from the box. I had issues with the screen right away. Then after only a year of very little use the screen completely quit. NO way to view anything. Take a picture or view pics. The touch screen is not a good thing from my point of view. The estimated cost to repair is almost the cost of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera except tiny little Problem!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from costco. Everything was good until I found one tiny little design flaw. The flash is so close to the zoom lens, if you take a close up shot the shadow of the zoom lens spoils your left hand corner of your picture.It all dark at the left bottom corner. Initially I thought it is my finger was on the flash and later discovered that the lens zoom is getting in the way of the flash.I wouldn't recommend this camera until they fix the flash issue. Wondering how it passed all the QC from Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Touch Screen is Hard to Use
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes great pictures and I was very happy with that part. The problem is in the touch screen. It's very hard to use, the menus are hard to navigate, and it doesn't respond to my finger so I have to have the little stylus with me all the time. I definitely recommend the Lumix but will choose the one with the buttons instead.
customer_reviews.author: GlowStarGI

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera...
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera with nice features, The only or most important con is the hard touch screen, Is harder to tap than expected
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, but battery is expensive and doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Love this little HD wonder, but the battery expires before the memory is half full. And spares are $50!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: This camera is garbage. We bought it for our office, we take pictures of clothing very often, and operating this is a nightmare. Trying to set the exposure to capture black stitching on black fabric was a headache, the touchscreen is ridiculous, I have to press on the same icon numerous times to get it to react. I really don't get how this camera is "easy to use", but it is easy to trash.
customer_reviews.author: hairspraymafia

customer_reviews.title: Like it so far....
customer_reviews.text: Just bought it at Costco a few days ago. So far I like the pics and how easy it is to use. I had to buy another camera because my year and a half old $650.00 Canon Rebel is in the shop. Took it to Mexico and it just stopped working. No photo memoires on that trip. I figure this camera will be a great back up .
customer_reviews.author: JD

product_meta.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH27 16MP 8x Zoom Digital Camera with 3.0" Touchscreen (Black)
product_meta.description: The new Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FH27 shoots high-quality 16.1 megapixel images and combines a 28mm wide-angle LEICA DC lens with a powerful 8x optical zoom to take amazing photos. Redesigned with an easy-to-hold grip and slim and stylish profile, it features a large 3.0" Intelligent LCD with Touch Screen, 720p High Definition (HD) video recording and an advanced iA (Intelligent Auto) for ease of use. 720p HD Movie - Creates dazzling high-definition videos Advanced Features - Intelligent Scene Selector Scene Detection & Intelligent ISO Control Motion DetectionSpecifications Sensor Size / Total Pixels / Filter - 1/2.33-inch / 16.6 Total Megapixels CCD / Primary Color Filter Effective Pixels - 16.1 Megapixels Lens - LEICA DC VARIO-ELMAR, 8x Optical Zoom Focal Length - f= 5-40mm (28-224mm in 35mm equivalent) Optical Image Stabilizer - MEGA O.I.S. LCD - 3.0 TFT Touch Screen LCD Display (230K dots) File Format - JPEG (DCF/Exif 2.3), Quicktime Motion JPEG, AVCHD Lite File Size - Still up to 4608 x 3456 (4 - 3); Movie up to HD 1280 x 720 (24fps) Storage Media - SD/SDHC/SDXC memory card Flash - Built-in Interface - AV Output (NTSC), USB 2.0 High-speed Power - Li-ion Battery Pack 3.6V, 660mAh Dimensions (WxHxD) - 3.9 x 2.2 x 1.1 in. Weight - Approx. 5.0 oz. without Battery and SD Memory Card
feature_bullets: Accessories Included - Battery Charger, Battery Pack, Stylus Pen, AV cable, USB Cable, Hand Strap, CD-ROMFeatures

3.0-inch High Resolution LCD - Large 3.0-inch LCD features high 230,000-dot resolution Intelligent LCD with Touch Screen. It automatically adjusts the brightness in 11 steps according to shooting conditions. This LCD provides sharp, clear images in virtually all-shooting situations, ranging from nighttime to bright daylight scenes.

Venus Engine VI - The high-speed, high-performance Venus Engine VI is incorporated in the camera to enable the recording of beautiful images with higher quality signal processing including the Intelligent Resolution technology. An advanced noise reduction system in the Venus Engine VI applies noise reduction (NR) to luminance noise and chromatic noise separately. As a result, beautiful images with minimal noise can be reproduced all the way up to ISO1600 high sensitivity at full resolution for

iA (Intelligent Auto) Mode - When you don't know which mode will give you the best shooting results, or when a sudden photo opportunity pops up and you don't have time to change any settings, simply choose the iA (Intelligent Auto) Mode and let the camera do it all for you.

The MEGA O.I.S. (Optical Image Stabilizer) - Compensates for the blurring caused by hand-shake. Even slight hand-shake movement is accurately detected by a sampling frequency of 4,000 times per second, and compensated to produce sharp, clear images.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars51 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
